DOCNAME: CASE OF SOLOVEY AND ZOZULYA v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Preliminary objections dismissed;Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 5-1;Violation of Art. 5-3;Non-pecuniary damage -award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE . They are currently detained .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON confessed that he , PERSON and PERSON . had killed PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON made a similar confession .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings against both applicants were initiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the pre - trial investigation was completed and the applicants were given time to study the case file .
CARDINAL . From DATE until DATE the applicants and other parties studied the case - file material . PERSON did so from DATE to DATE , and PERSON from DATE to DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was referred to ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) , acting as a first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court committed the applicants for trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted both applicants of aggravated murder and robbery ; and sentenced each of them to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE quashed the judgment and remitted the case for additional pre - trial investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal case against the applicants was sent to the prosecutor ’s office for an additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor General lodged a request for extraordinary review of the decision of ORG of DATE with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected the request for the review and the case was sent back to the investigator .
CARDINAL . On DATE the additional investigation was completed and the applicants were given time to study the case file .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was referred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG remitted the case for additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , after additional investigation , the case was referred again to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG committed the applicants for trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted PERSON and PERSON PERSON of aggravated murder and robbery ; and sentenced them , respectively , to CARDINAL and ten years’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . Mr Solovey and Mr PERSON were arrested on CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the detention of PERSON for DATE on the ground that he had committed a serious offence and might abscond .
CARDINAL . On DATE the same preventive measure was chosen for Mr Solovey on the same grounds .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG prolonged the applicants’ detention DATE until DATE for Mr PERSON and DATE for Mr Solovey .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the committal hearing , maintained the applicants’ detention without giving any grounds or fixing any time limit .
CARDINAL . In its judgment of DATE ORG , having convicted the applicants , also decided that they should remain in custody until the judgment became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having quashed the judgment of DATE in full , made no ruling in respect of the ORG further detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicants’ detention for DATE until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy Prosecutor General extended the applicants’ detention to DATE without giving any grounds – up to DATE for PERSON and up to DATE for Mr Solovey .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having remitted the case for additional investigation , maintained the applicants’ detention without giving any reason or fixing any time - limits .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicants’ further detention for DATE until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the committal hearings , maintained the applicants’ detention without giving any reason or fixing any time - limits .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicants .

CARDINAL . From DATE the applicants and their representatives lodged numerous procedural applications with ORG , ORG and ORG , requesting the ORG release . They also submitted several complaints to the prosecutors and ORG alleging that their detention had been unlawful between DATE and DATE when they had been studying the case file and their detention had not been covered by any detention order ( see paragraphs CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE above ) .

CARDINAL . NORP ORG , in reply to the applicants’ requests and complaints , informed them that their detention had been in compliance with the law and that there had been no grounds for their release . It did not advance any other reasoning to justify the applicants’ detention .

CARDINAL . ORG , in its decisions of CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE , maintained the applicants’ detention on remand stating that the preventive measure chosen by the investigation was correct ( see paragraphs CARDINAL , DATE and DATE above ) . It did not , however , address the applicants’ complaints about the alleged unlawfulness of their detention DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG , in its decisions of DATE and DATE , did not make any ruling on the applicants’ further detention ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :

“ If there are sufficient grounds to consider that the accused , if at liberty , will abscond from an investigation or the court , or will obstruct the establishment of the truth in a criminal case or will pursue criminal activities , and in order to ensure the execution of the sentence , the investigator and prosecutor shall be entitled to impose on the accused one of the preventive measures envisaged by LAW ... ”
“ The preventive measures shall be as follows :
( CARDINAL ) a written undertaking not to abscond ;
( CARDINAL ) a personal surety ;
( CARDINAL ) the surety of a public organisation or labour collective ;
( DATE ) NORP bail ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP remand in custody ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP supervision by the command of a military unit . ”

“ Detention on remand as a preventive measure shall be applied in cases concerning offences for which the law envisages a penalty of DATE imprisonment . In exceptional circumstances this preventive measure can be applied also in cases concerning offences for which the law envisages a penalty of DATE imprisonment ... ”

“ The term for remanding a person in custody during the investigation of criminal offences shall be not DATE . This term may be extended to DATE by district , city or military prosecutors , prosecutors of the fleet or command garrison , or other prosecutors of the same rank , if it is not possible to terminate the criminal investigation , and in the absence of any grounds for changing the preventive measure . A further extension of this term to DATE from the time of arrest shall be effected only if the case is exceptionally complex , by ORG , regional prosecutors , GPE prosecutors , military prosecutors of the district or fleet , or other prosecutors equal to them in rank .
Further periods of remand in custody may be extended for DATE by ORG , and DATE by ORG .
Subsequent to the above , no further extensions of detention on remand shall be allowed . The accused must then be immediately released .

If it is impossible to terminate the investigation within these remand periods and there are no grounds for changing the preventive measure , the Prosecutor General or his Deputy shall be entitled to refer the case to a court in the part which relates to accusations which can be proved . As regards the incomplete investigation , the case shall be divided into separate proceedings and completed in accordance with the general rules .

The material relating to the completed part of the criminal case shall be provided to the accused and his representative for examination not DATE before the expiry of the remand period , as established by paragraph CARDINAL of this Article .
The time taken by the accused and his representative to apprise themselves of the material in the case file shall not be taken into account in calculating the overall term of remand in custody .

If the court refers the case back for a freshtime he receives the case file . Further prolongation of such detention , before the case is remitted to the court , shall be governed by DATE , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of this Article . ”
Article CARDINAL
Terms of examination of the case by a single judge or a court in the committal hearing
“ A criminal case shall be examined by a single judge or a court in the committal hearing within DATE or , in complex cases , DATE after its receipt by the court . ”
Article CARDINAL ( as worded at the material time ) : Issues considered when committing the accused for trial
“ Single judges or a court in a preparatory sitting shall consider the following issues with respect to each of the accused :
( CARDINAL ) whether the preventive measure with respect to the accused has been selected correctly ... ”
Article CARDINAL ( as worded at the material time ) : Decision of a court or of a single judge at the preparatory hearing
“ ... If it is necessary to change the preventive measure , the court in a ruling and the judge in a resolution shall give reasons for the decision taken to that effect . ”
